required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Low Level Laser Intervention for Individuals With Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Low Level Laser Intervention on Muscular Strength for Individuals With Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the intervention effects of low level laser for knee OA group

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of muscular strength of thigh measured by handheld dynamometer
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatment, 8 weeks intervention
primary_outcome.description: Muscular strength of the knee extensor and flexor on both sides and will be normalized by the body weight of participants' (lb/kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of walking speed measured by the stop watch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatment, 8 weeks intervention
secondary_outcome.description: 40-m walk test, participants are instructed to walk as fast as they could, investigator records the time they spend. (seconds)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of stair climbing ability measured by the stop watch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatment, 8 weeks intervention
secondary_outcome.description: stair climbing test, participants are instructed to climb stairs with a total height of 180 cm as fast as they could, investigator records the time they spend. (seconds)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of chair stand ability, the stop watch will be used to measure time and investigators count the time that participants complete
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatment, 8 weeks intervention
secondary_outcome.description: sit-to-stand test, participants are instructed to repeat chair stand movement as fast as they could, investigator records the times they complete. (times)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of dynamic balance ability measured by the stop watch
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatment, 8 weeks intervention
secondary_outcome.description: timed UP&Go test, participants are instructed to stand up from a chair and walk as fast as they could for 3 meters and back to the chair, investigator records the time they spend. (seconds)

other_outcome.measure: Changes of joint range of motion measured by the goniometer
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and after treatment, 8 weeks intervention
other_outcome.description: Joint range of motion of the hip flexion, internal and external rotation, knee flexion, extension on both sides(degrees)

arm_group.description: The wavelength of this experimental group was 808nm, total power: 3.6W, 15 minutes a session, 3 times a week for 8 weeks
The wavelength of this experimental group was 660nm, total power: 3.6W, 15 minutes a session, 3 times a week for 8 weeks
The wavelength of control group, total power: 0.0072W, 15 minutes a session, 3 times a week for 8 weeks

intervention.description: The intervention protocol includes 2 wavelength as the experimental group, each of the were 808nm, 660nm, and 1 placebo intervention which output total power is only 0.0072W.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The severity of osteoarthritis was defined by the Kellgren-Lawrence system as grade 2 - grade 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Malignant tumor
- Skin cancer
- Pregnant
- Dysesthesia
- Pacemaker inplement
- Cognitive problem
- Fall record within 6 months
- Dysfunction of blood coagulation

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Physical Therapy, National Cheng-Kung University

facility.name: Department of Physical Therapy, National Cheng-Kung University
